data.title: Add alias support to commands
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

- VSCode Version: 1.10.x
- OS Version: all

Commands do not provide an alias property hence we can't show an original English version of a command.

I broke tasks for 1.10 since the workbench actions got moved to commands for better keyboard shortcut support.

data.title: Empty foreground in TM themes get parsed as red
data.body:
Moreover, probably due to a truey check (over an empty string) the TM scopes widget misleads and reports that no theme selector matched a certain scope.

See gerane/VSCodeThemes#33

[HalfLife.tmTheme.txt](https://github.com/gerane/VSCodeThemes/files/820745/HalfLife.tmTheme.txt)

data.title: "Save All" replaces file content with other file content.

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
## - VSCode Version & other details
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/3015241/23602256/b5898c1a-0275-11e7-9a94-62f9bb705cd1.png)


### **Steps to Reproduce:**
1. Open Multiple files (say file1, file2, file3, file4) from a folder which are already saved (no changes pending to save)
2. Modify say file1 (don't say yet)
3. Go to file 2, Modify something in it.
4. Go to Click on menu "File".
5. Click on "Save All" from the file menu.
6. Check the content on the current file, i.e. file2.
7. All the contents from file1 is overwritten on file2.

**Expected:** Both files should get saved with proper file content.

**Actual:** Only file1 gets saved, file2 is not yet saved & content is overwritten.

data.title: Auto save triggers save conflict error very easily
data.body:
Steps to Reproduce:

1. disable auto save (makes it easier to reproduce)
2. edit a file without saving
3. change the file with external editor
4. try to save within Code
5. you get a save error that is OK and you can dismiss
6. enable auto save onFocusLost

=> every time you change the editor you see the save conflict error popping up

The fix is to ignore files that are in conflict (aka changed on disk) unless the user is explicitly saving

data.title: Intellisence not recognizing folders as modules for node
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

F12 to find definition only works if the path points to a js file. Doesn't work when node style index based modules are used.

```javascript
import work from './src/work'; // => ./src/work.js
import notWorking from './src/notWorking'; // => ./src/notWorking/index.js

```

- VSCode Version: 1.10.1
- OS Version: macOS 10.12.3

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Press F12 on desired module imports to try to jump to the file.
2. Doesn't work if the path points to a folder containing a index.js file.

data.title: Allow to configure `window.title` with _external variables_
data.body:
Hi,

In the February Release, we can now [Customize the Window Title](https://code.visualstudio.com/updates/v1_10#_configurable-window-title), based on a set of variables, which is a great feature  

Had you thought about allowing extensions to _publish new variables_ to be used by `window.title` setting?

[This issue](https://github.com/alefragnani/vscode-project-manager/issues/98) was added on my  [Project Manager](https://marketplace.visualstudio.com/items?itemName=alefragnani.project-manager) extension, and the idea is to _publish_ the `Project Name`.

I was thinking that it could be achieved using something like the `setContext` command, used for customizing key bindings rules

Thanks in advance

data.title: Linux Nautilus Integration
data.body:
When in Windows, if I right-click a file or folder, in the context menu I have an option to open the file/folder with VSCode.

I'd like to ask to have the same behavior in Linux.

A solution for that is the `python-nautilus` that allows for the creation of context menus on nautilus. Please visit https://wiki.gnome.org/Projects/NautilusPython

data.title: Unable to select all text in internalConsole or integratedTerminal
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.8.1
- OS Version: Windows 10

Steps to Reproduce:

1.Run some app that spews a bunch of stuff to the console
2.Try to select it all
3. Notice that select/drag does not scroll the window.  
4. Select at the top then scroll down to shift select at the bottom. 
5. Notice that the selection is trimmed to the top visible line.
6. Try the same thing but starting at the bottom and going up
7. Notice that the selection is similarly trimmed.

data.title: Fixed to be able to search commands in English command name when locale set to `ja`
data.body:
In 1.10.1 Release, if `locale` is configured to `ja`, I can't search some of commands related to Task( for example `Tasks: Run Task`) from command pallete.
It cause some change made some commands searched with translated command's title.

I fixed the bug with this PR
I think it's very annoying to change input mode to search commands, so It's better to be fixed as soon as possible.

data.title: Setting theme doesn't respect indentation in settings
data.body:
* Open the command palette
* Choose "Color theme"
* Select a theme
* Open the command palette
* Choose user settings

**Expected:** The theme setting would match the indentation style of the settings file

**Actual:** It uses tabs instead of spaces despite the file using only spaces and the settings configured to use spaces.

data.title: mini map background color not using background color
data.body:
playing around with themes
mini map takes "background" color if set, like edit/tree pane does
mini map does not take "background" color from the base theme specified with the uiTheme tag

so if I make a empty theme with no settings except pointing to vs or vs-dark ui theme
the light one will have light background
the dark one will have dark background but light mini map background
